refnamediv.refpurpose: Control signals based on linear segments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Generate control signal consisiting of linear segments delimited by two or more specified points. The entire envelope can be looped at time-variant rate. Each segment coordinate can also be varied at k-rate.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ksig loopsegp kphase, kvalue0, kdur0, kvalue1 \ [, kdur1, ... , kdurN-1, kvalueN]

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kphase - point of the sequence read, expressed as a fraction of a cycle (0 to 1)
kdur0 ...kdurN-1 - duration of points expessed in fraction of a cycle

loopsegp opcode is similar to loopseg; the only difference is that, instead of frequency, a time-variant phase is required. If you use phasor to get the phase value, you will have a behaviour identical to loopseg, but interesting results can be achieved when using phases having non-linear motions, making loopsegp more powerful and general than loopseg.
